description: Proposed by Sungyong Chung, Yanlin Zhang, Nachuan Li, Dana Monzer, and Alireza Talebpour, this is a safety-enhanced variant of the MC-CF paradigm. It incorporates Time-To-Collision (TTC) thresholds to bias acceleration sampling towards lower percentiles in critical scenarios, ensuring safer trajectory generation.
assumptions: Markovian dynamics with probabilistic safety constraints: assumes drivers adopt conservative accelerations (bottom 5-30%) when TTC is below critical thresholds.
calibration: Calibration-free. It empirically derives state transitions and acceleration distributions directly from the OpenCF Training Set.
